abstract: As JPMorgan Chase prepares an investment book to circulate to potential bidders of Chrysler, American and foreign auto companies, private equity groups and investment banks are chomping at the bit to inspect the struggling company’s financial data. “Everybody will take a look,” a senior executive at a global car company, which will be eyeballing the book, told The New York Times.
lead_paragraph: As JPMorgan Chase prepares an investment book to circulate to potential bidders of Chrysler, American and foreign auto companies, private equity groups and investment banks are chomping at the bit to inspect the struggling company’s financial data. “Everybody will take a look,” a senior executive at a global car company, which will be eyeballing the book, told The New York Times.

headline.main: Many Are Eager to See Data on Chrysler
